com.milk.gui
Class JFrame

                          +--javax.swing.JFrame
                                |
                                +--com.milk.gui.JFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class JFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This is a replacement for (subclass of, actually) javax.swing.JFrame, that knows about iconification.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

isIconified

public boolean isIconified()
Return true if the frame is iconified. Note that a frame must be showing to be iconified.

Returns:
true if the frame is iconified

show

public void show()
Deprecated. Use setVisible (true) instead.

Override of JFrame.show () to deiconify the frame if it is iconified.

Overrides:
show in class java.awt.Window

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean visibility)
Override of JFrame.setVisible () to deiconify the frame if it is iconified and the parameter is true.

Overrides:
setVisible in class java.awt.Component
Parameters:
visibility - the visibility

deiconify

public void deiconify()
Deiconify the frame, but only if the frame is already showing (in an iconified state).
